decks.notes: This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to flood the board with tokens from cards like Dragon Fodder and Hordeling Outburst, while boosting their power and dealing additional damage with spells like Atarka's Command, Lightning Strike, and Wild Slash. The aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Zurgo Bellstriker, and Goblin Rabblemaster aim to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total before finishing them off with burn spells like Stoke the Flames.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various forms of removal and counterspells, while also utilizing powerful dragons like Ugin and Dragonlord Silumgar to establish board presence and close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Foul-Tongue Invocation, while also having access to card draw and selection tools like Jace's Ingenuity and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements and allow for flexibility in casting spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through ramping up mana using cards like Elvish Mystic, Rattleclaw Mystic, and Sylvan Caryatid. This allows the player to quickly summon big creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Polukranos, World Eater. The deck also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Whisperwood Elemental to provide additional value and card advantage. Another key aspect is the inclusion of See the Unwritten, which allows the player to cheat in powerful creatures from their deck. The deck focuses on utilizing green ramp to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering and removing opponent's threats. It utilizes cards like Dissolve, Hero's Downfall, and Bile Blight to manage the board. It also includes cards like Dig Through Time and Jace's Ingenuity to draw additional cards for advantage. The deck features powerful planeswalkers like Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also has a variety of board wipes and removal spells, such as Crux of Fate and Perilous Vault, to maintain dominance.

This deck focuses on putting strong pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures and powerful removal spells. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with high-impact threats like Siege Rhino and Elspeth, Sun's Champion. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm, while also building up its own board presence. Overall, the deck seeks to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Elvish Mystic, Voyaging Satyr, and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx in order to play powerful high-cost creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Genesis Hydra early on. It also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Whisperwood Elemental to control the board and generate card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creature threats while having the ability to ramp up mana consistently throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on playing strong creatures like Thunderbreak Regent and Stormbreath Dragon, supported by mana accelerants like Elvish Mystic and Rattleclaw Mystic. The burn spells, such as Roast, Draconic Roar, and Crater's Claws, provide additional removal options and can also be used to finish off the opponent. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and direct damage, while also maintaining a decent amount of mana fixing for consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various removal spells, counterspells, and powerful dragons. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. Overall, the strategy of this deck revolves around gradually gaining control of the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and versatile spells.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Rakshasa Deathdealer, and Siege Rhino to pressure the opponent. Anafenza, the Foremost and Surrak, the Hunt Caller provide additional power and speed. The deck also includes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Dromoka's Command to deal with opposing threats. With a good mix of creatures and removal, this Abzan Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure throughout the match.

The main strategy of this deck is to aggressively control the board with removal spells like Murderous Cut, Ultimate Price, Bile Blight, and Hero's Downfall while bringing out powerful creatures like Courser of Kruphix, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck utilizes a mix of black, white, and green mana sources to cast its spells and relies on card advantage cards like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm to stay ahead in the game. Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides a powerful finisher, while Garruk, Apex Predator can take out opponent's threats and generate card advantage.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. The key focus is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also setting up powerful threats like Dragonlord Ojutai and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game. The deck aims to maintain control of the board and resources until it can establish a dominant position and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and dragons.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Courser of Kruphix, while using powerful green creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Whisperwood Elemental to dominate the battlefield. The deck focuses on efficiently ramping up mana to play large threats earlier than the opponent can handle, while also utilizing cards like Mastery of the Unseen to generate additional value and board presence. By combining ramp and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Siege Rhino. It also includes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to control the board. The deck includes a mix of creatures with powerful abilities, such as Anafenza, the Foremost and Surrak, the Hunt Caller. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of white, black, and green, with a mix of temples and dual lands to ensure consistent and efficient mana production.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficient and powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Fleecemane Lion, and Anafenza, the Foremost. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to control the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Ajani, Mentor of Heroes provide additional support and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and resilient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent while maintaining control and card advantage. This is achieved through a combination of efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Courser of Kruphix, and Siege Rhino, alongside removal spells like Bile Blight and Hero's Downfall. The deck also features disruption in the form of Thoughseize and Abzan Charm, allowing the player to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Elspeth, Sun's Champion provide additional threats and utility to close out games.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw. By using powerful dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Silumgar, the Drifting Death, along with support from cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Crux of Fate, it aims to dominate the game in the mid to late stages. With a strong mana base and a mix of hand disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and taking control of the board with powerful dragons. It uses a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and stabilize the game until it can take over with powerful threats like Dragonlord Ojutai and Silumgar, the Drifting Death. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to seal the game. The mana base is designed to support the control game plan with a mix of dual lands and utility lands.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, aiming to stabilize the board and out-value the opponent in the late game. It includes powerful threats like Ugin and Dragonlord Ojutai, while also utilizing cards like Dig Through Time to find answers when needed. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with lands that provide various colors of mana and utility lands like Haven of the Spirit Dragon. By managing the board and resources effectively, the deck aims to grind out victories through attrition and card advantage.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures like Stormbreath Dragon and Thunderbreak Regent to deal fast damage to the opponent. The deck also includes ramp with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to help cast big threats like Dragonlord Atarka. Removal spells like Crater's Claws and Draconic Roar provide additional reach and board control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures, burn spells, and ramping into powerful threats.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up with cards like Elvish Mystic and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, and then overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Avatar of the Resolute and Fleecemane Lion. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By establishing an early aggressive board presence and utilizing efficient creature spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and swiftly end the game in its favor.

The main focus of this deck is to establish an aggressive board presence using mana ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to quickly play powerful threats such as Deathmist Raptor and Dragonlord Ojutai. The deck also utilizes cards like Den Protector and Mastery of the Unseen for card advantage and resilience. The inclusion of Surrak, the Hunt Caller adds additional pressure to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Dromoka's Command and Valorous Stance provide removal and protection for your creatures. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production and fixing.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. It aims to deal damage quickly and aggressively, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Lightning Berserker to apply pressure. The burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames help to control the board and finish off the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain tempo, play on curve, and capitalize on any openings to deal damage and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid, allowing for early plays of powerful threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Stormbreath Dragon. Using Chord of Calling and Temple of Abandon for additional flexibility and card selection, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells like Roast and Setessan Tactics. The inclusion of cards like Hornet Nest and Whisperwood Elemental provides resilience against board wipes and allows for potential blowout plays.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by countering and removing opponent's threats using a variety of spells like Negate, Disdainful Stroke, and Valorous Stance. The deck also includes board wipes like End Hostilities and Perilous Vault to clear the board if necessary. Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Dragonlord Ojutai provide win conditions and card advantage. The deck also features card draw with Anticipate and Dig Through Time to help find key cards. The mana base allows for consistent access to both white and blue mana sources.

This deck focuses on powerful and efficient creatures with a mix of removal and disruption spells to control the board and push through aggressive damage. The key strategy is to play threats like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix backed up by removal spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide powerful finishers to close out the game. The deck's mana base ensures consistency and allows for casting spells of different colors easily.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence of creatures with heroic abilities that can be protected and pumped up with spells like Defiant Strike, Gods Willing, and Ajani's Presence. By triggering heroic abilities and attacking aggressively, the deck aims to outpace opponents and deal significant damage quickly. The deck includes card draw options like Treasure Cruise and Ordeal of Thassa to maintain momentum. This aggressive strategy is supported by a mana base that allows for consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up your mana quickly using green cards like Elvish Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Rattleclaw Mystic, in order to play big threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Dragonlord Atarka, and Arbor Colossus. The control aspect of the deck comes from cards like Courser of Kruphix and Whisperwood Elemental providing stabilization and card advantage. By efficiently ramping and controlling the board, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by removing threats from the opponent and manipulating the battlefield through counterspells and removal spells. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through draw spells like Dig Through Time and anticipate. By playing powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, the deck can quickly close out the game once it has stabilized the board. With a focus on disruption and resource management, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through careful decision-making and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Soulfire Grand Master, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Mantis Rider to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes powerful dragons like Thunderbreak Regent and Dragonlord Ojutai to keep up the pressure. The deck utilizes burn spells like Stoke the Flames and Draconic Roar to remove threats and finish off opponents. Ojutai's Command provides versatility in countering spells and gaining life. The mana base is designed to allow for a balance of colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also using Jeskai Ascendancy to pump up the team and generate card advantage. Seeker of the Way and Hordeling Outburst provide a fast start, while Treasure Cruise refills the hand. Lightning Strike and Wild Slash provide removal and reach, while Raise the Alarm and Secure the Wastes help go wide. Valorous Stance protects key creatures, and Stoke the Flames acts as a finisher. The deck aims to close out games quickly by applying pressure and maintaining card advantage.

This deck focuses on aggressively casting powerful dragons and disrupting opponents with hand disruption and removal spells. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Thunderbreak Regent, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents before they can fully develop their own strategy. With a mix of direct damage, removal, and hand disruption, this deck is designed to be a versatile and formidable force in any match-up.

The deck focuses on a strong graveyard strategy, utilizing cards like Satyr Wayfinder, Sylvan Caryatid, and Courser of Kruphix to fill the graveyard with creatures. This allows for powerful plays with cards like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Torrent Elemental. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Dragonlord Silumgar and Tasigur, the Golden Fang for additional threats. Removal spells like Murderous Cut and Thoughtseize help control the board, while cards like Whip of Erebos provide additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Voyaging Satyr to quickly generate mana and play large threats such as Polukranos, World Eater and Whisperwood Elemental. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Den Protector while using Mastery of the Unseen to generate value over time. Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx is key in generating massive amounts of green mana to power out big creatures. Overall, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to quickly establish board presence with cards like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, while efficiently dealing with threats through spells such as Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides additional win conditions and board control. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck focuses on aggression and control to outpace and outlast opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of powerful removal spells and resilient creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent. It includes a variety of creatures with high toughness, such as Courser of Kruphix and Siege Rhino, to stabilize the board and gain life advantage. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion to generate card advantage and provide a win condition. Additionally, the deck utilizes a small graveyard interaction with cards like Sidisi, Undead Vizier and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, to further disrupt the opponent's plans and gain value.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent, while also having access to removal spells and a small amount of disruption. The deck aims to generate card advantage through cards like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Den Protector, while also being able to generate additional value through cards like Whip of Erebos. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure a smooth curve and consistent access to the different colors required for the deck's spells and abilities.

This deck focuses on quickly pressuring the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. The main strategy is to play aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Deathmist Raptor to deal early damage and maintain board presence. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Ultimate Price and Hero's Downfall to eliminate threats from the opponent. In addition, the deck features cards like Anafenza, the Foremost and Siege Rhino to apply additional pressure and gain card advantage. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all the necessary colors for the deck's spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Jeskai Ascendancy combo. The deck aims to quickly set up a powerful board state by using cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Nyx-Fleece Ram for early defense and mana ramp. It then digs through the deck with cards like Dig Through Time and Taigam's Scheming to find Jeskai Ascendancy and other combo pieces. Once Jeskai Ascendancy is on the field, the deck can generate a lot of mana and draw a large number of cards, allowing it to combo off and win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the abilities of Chromanticore and Soulflayer to create a powerful aggro strategy. The deck includes a mix of creatures that provide various abilities such as hexproof, deathtouch, and flying, making it difficult for opponents to block or remove them. The deck also includes cards like Commune with the Gods and Satyr Wayfinder to quickly fill the graveyard and enable the abilities of Soulflayer. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of versatile creatures and graveyard manipulation.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently play aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and devotion to red, the deck can generate large amounts of mana to cast powerful creatures like Dragon Whisperer and Thunderbreak Regent. The inclusion of burn spells like Wild Slash and Roast provide additional reach to finish off opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and burn spells to secure victory.

This deck focuses on playing powerful creatures like Dragonlord Ojutai and Thunderbreak Regent to quickly overwhelm the opponent with damage. It also includes a mix of counter spells like Silumgar's Scorn and Stubborn Denial to protect its creatures and control the board. The deck also includes some removal spells like Anger of the Gods and Valorous Stance to deal with opposing threats. In addition, the deck includes card draw spells like Anticipate and Dig Through Time to ensure a constant stream of threats and answers. The mana base is designed to ensure a smooth curve of spells while providing the necessary colors of mana for the deck.

The core strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while using Jeskai Ascendancy to pump them up and generate value. The deck focuses on creating tokens with cards like Goblin Rabblemaster, Dragon Fodder, and Raise the Alarm, and then using spells like Stoke the Flames and Wild Slash to finish off the opponent. Treasure Cruise and Anticipate help dig through the deck for key pieces, while Valorous Stance and Disdainful Stroke provide protection and disruption. The land base is built for consistency and mana fixing.

This deck focuses on utilizing green ramp cards to quickly build up mana and play powerful creatures, such as Polukranos, World Eater and Hornet Queen. It also includes control elements like Doomwake Giant to handle opposing threats. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures while maintaining control of the board. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Whip of Erebos and Eidolon of Blossoms provides additional value and resilience. The deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent through efficient ramp and powerful threats.
